item.title: Report E-2024080092
item.description:
Report E-2024080092

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, at 1418 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Dayton Freight Lines personnel in Des Plains, Illinois regarding the release of approximately 2 gallons of 1447810 Gray Epoxy Paint (UN1263, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. It was reported that terminal personnel placed the damaged drum in a 65-gallon metal overpack, then neutralized and cleaned the release. All waste was reportedly placed along with the damaged drum in the 65-gallon overpack and staged onsite for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024072341
item.description:
Report X-2024072341

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-24
  • City: DECATUR
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package arrived in QA soaked through on a side. Package had an internal cardboard box filled with aerosol cans. One can had a small puncture or rupture just below the top, spilling its contents.into package. Exterior box had no limited quantity marking. Verified through SPIDR that there was no marking at any point it was in the network.

item.title: Report X-2024080034
item.description:
Report X-2024080034

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING CORROSIVE PACKAGE AT BAY 19. USING DECISION TREE FOR CORROSIVES AND PPE, RESPONDER CONTAINED THE LEAK AND PROCESSED IT THROUGH THE DMP. THE PACKAGE CONTAINED FOUR, ONE GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF WHICH ONE HAD A LOOSE CAP. ALL FOUR CONTAINERS WERE CONTAMINATED.
